paper_abstract: The multifingers' parasitic capacitances modeling of 65-nm CMOS transistors for millimeter-wave application is presented. The modeling is based on simulation approach, which is done by building the devices true dimension in high-frequency structure simulator environment. The material properties of the devices as given by the foundry are used during simulation and then full electromagnetic simulations are carried out to extract the Y-parameters of the model. Unit-cell parameters extraction method is carried out in order to save memory and simulation time. In this case, the multifinger transistors are divided into unit-cells and then the parasitic capacitances of the unit-cells are calculated from the extracted Y-parameter. Based on linear scaling, the parasitic capacitance of the multifingers transistor can be obtained with good accuracy (less than 5% error). (C) 2012 Wiley Periodicals, Inc. Int J RF and Microwave CAE , 2012.
paper_title: Multifingers capacitances modeling of 65-Nm CMOS transistor by unit cell method
